page.title: 20TRANSPORT.
page.content: {RURAL ROADS IN OWSTON AREA Everyone in Owston has at least one motor vehicle which is essential for movement in and out of the village, and some have 4_wheel drive cars for extra mobility. Farmers use tractors for movement on the farms. Owston has no public transport. Situated two miles from a main road, Owston is served by minor roads. In snowy weather a farmer is contracted to clear the snow. Some people have bicycles or motor cycles. {COMPILED AND WRITTEN BY MEMBERS OF {KNOSSINGTON WOMEN'S INSTITUTE: JANET BUCHANAN RITA SMITH ALICE COX SHIRLEY SPENCER PAT HARVEY MILLICENT HILL MARY WATKINS {PHOTOGRAPHS BY}JONATHAN BUCHANAN. {RECORDED BY KNOSSINGTON GRANGE SCHOOL. {(}D.L.HOPPE{)
